Hartford.Clay Hill Historic District: The Clay Hill Historic District in Hartford, Connecticut is a 60-acre (24 ha) historic district that was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1983, and expanded in 1984. Northwest of Downtown Hartford, the district is roughly bounded by Main, Mather, Garden, and Walnut Streets. The Clay Hill Historic District spans roughly 60 acres of the neighborhood and contains examples of Queen Anne, Italianiate and Neoclassical Revival architecture.
